Let me tell you a little about myself and what I do ...

Aerospace Engineering student by day and Tech Ninja by night.


I am a Msc. Aerospace Engineering student at Delft University of Technology in The Netherlands (#4 Worldwide in Aerospace Engineering - QS Ranking). I specialize in creating control and simulation tools for every mechanical device that reaches the skies by using classical and modern control theory techniques using MATLAB and Simulink, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence Techniques and ocassionally the 3D printer to create customized drones.

In my spare time, I like to learn and play with everything that is interesting and related to IT, technology and autonomy such as: FinTech, Blockchain, Cyber Security, Web Development, Autonomous (Air) Vehicles, Artificial Intelligence, Robotics and much more ...
Outside that, I am also a practical person that likes to play around with embedded systems using the Arduino and turn my room into a "smart" companion that pretty much automate my life and increase my laziness level.

As you may already figured out, I am a big tech head and I always seek new adventures within the world of Technology, Engineering and IT development. Do not hesitate to reach out to me if you have any awesome opportunities for me or just want to hang out and talk about anything!
